data.text:
Individual city tours, sensing the Leipzig Freedom

Because we know and love our city, we want to share our enthusiasm with you. On our guided tours, we offer you everything that is most important to you from the perspective of a local. Immerse yourself in the fascinating history of Leipzig and find out where to find the best viewpoints, cafés and restaurants.

Experience the Places of interest The city centre, such as St. Thomas Church, St. Nicholas Church as the starting point of the Peaceful Revolution in autumn 89, the Old Town Hall on Leipzig Market Square, the Leipzig Gewandhaus and, of course, the Mädler Passage with the historic Auerbachs Keller.

Tour guide for Individual Leipzig tours can be booked by individuals, small or large groups. Whether city tours through the old town of Leipzig, excursions to the surrounding area, guided tours of the city centre or museum visits - we are happy to organise tailor-made adventure programmes for you.

For groups, whether you are in Leipzig with your company, as a teacher with a school class or for a weekend with friends, we are happy to offer you private city tours in Leipzig that are individually tailored to your interests. In addition to the topics that particularly interest you, we can also combine your tour with a tasting of local specialities, restaurant bookings or recommendations or team event activities in Leipzig.

Our highly trained and certified Leipzig tour guides are always enthusiastic about Leipzig and present Leipzig's tourist highlights to our visitors from near and far every day.

Take part in our tours - Walk Leipzig like a local!

Where to stay in Leipzig?

Leipzig City Hall is located between the historic Naschmarkt and Markt squares. Surrounding these attractions are the Nikolai Church and some of the beautiful old shopping arcades that characterise the city's historic centre. The railway station is very close by. Here are some very good hotels in the historic centre of Leipzig:

Luxury:

The Steigenberger Grandhotel Handelshof is located in a historic building with modern amenities, including a spa with sauna and steam bath, directly on the Naschmarkt and next to the Nikolaikirche. ☑ Check availability and prices here.

Mid-range:

Opposite St Thomas' Church and a five-minute walk from the market square and the Old Town Hall is the INNSIDE Leipzigone of the newer hotels in the city, which offers excellent value for money and a beautiful roof terrace. ☑ Check availability and prices here.

Budget:

There are also 3 Motel One hotels right in the city centre:

Motel One Leipzig-Augustusplatz (4.6/5) - Modern budget hotel with free WiFi

Hotel Motel One Leipzig-Nikolaikirche (4.5/5) - Chic hotel with a trendy bar

Motel One Leipzig-Post (4.6/5) - Hip hotel with bar & roof terrace
